member.name: M:EmailAddressLibrary.EmailAddressValidator.Msdn(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given email address is valid using MSDN implementation. https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01escwtf%28v=vs.100%29.aspx
member.returns: True if the given email address is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:EmailAddressLibrary.EmailAddressValidator.ReferenceSource(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given email address is valid using Reference Source implementation. http://referencesource.microsoft.com
member.returns: True if the given email address is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:EmailAddressLibrary.EmailAddressValidator.Haacked(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given email address is valid using Phil Haack's implementation. http://haacked.com/archive/2007/08/21/i-knew-how-to-validate-an-email-address-until-i.aspx
member.returns: True if the given email address is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:EmailAddressLibrary.EmailAddressValidator.JStedfast(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given email address is valid using Jeffrey Stedfast's implementation. https://github.com/jstedfast/EmailValidation
member.returns: True if the given email address is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:EmailAddressLibrary.Implementations.JStedfastValidator.Validate(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validate the specified email address.

remarks.para: Validates the syntax of an email address.
If is true, then the validator will allow addresses with top-level domains like postmaster@dk.
If is true, then the validator will use the newer International Email standards for validating the email address.

member.returns: true if the email address is valid; otherwise, false.
member.param: true if the validator should allow addresses at top-level domains; otherwise, false.
true if the validator should allow international characters; otherwise, false.
